page.title: 04HALFWAY BRIDGE, LODSWORTH
page.content: {Travellers : slow down & don't blink! The new line of the{A272}by-passes this hamlet on the west bank of the River Lod between Petworth and Midhurst. A dozen dwellings with an old mill, a former coaching Inn, a modern factory assembling display panels and a police office are missed by the traveller who speeds by. We walked with Mrs Enticknap along the old road as she described the buildings and paths up to Lodsworth.It was fun playing Pooh-sticks on the old bridge but the most exciting place was the cellar of the old Inn:it was dark, smelly and spooky. Mr & Mrs Greenwood invited us in to see the former stable now a games room, the low ceilinged bars and the deep cellar.{BAR PRICES:} {Bitter,82p/pt;Lager90p/pt;Cider60p/bot {Cola42p;Whisky62p;Gin62p;brandy76p; {Wine77p/glass;Sherry62p; JUNE 1985
